intro: Diplolophium buchananii subsp. swynnertonii, commonly known as the Swynnerton's Diplolophium, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests or along riverbanks. It is notable for its unique morphology and is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and ecological significance. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
